question.title: Is it possible to register a JmsListener programmatically with enabled transactions
question.body:
Spring documentation describes how to register a JMS listener programatically, but the endpoint API described there does not have any transactional flags available. Is there any way to make this listener transactional so it could replace listener class like this?

@Component
@Transactional // NOTE transactional annotation is here
@RequiredArgsConstructor
public class OrderMessageListener
{

    @JmsListener(destination = "channel_name_does_not_matter")
    public void handle(Object message)
    {
        // handle message
    }

question_comments.body: Here is the documentation on processing messages within transactions docs.spring.io/spring-framework/docs/4.2.x/…. You can just follow the configuration of the container, then have the JmsListener use the configured container
